snippet: A Federal judge today struck down major parts of the campaign contribution limits that became law when a ballot initiative was approved by California voters in November 1996.    The judge, Lawrence Karlton of Federal District Court here, concluded...
lead_paragraph: A Federal judge today struck down major parts of the campaign contribution limits that became law when a ballot initiative was approved by California voters in November 1996. The judge, Lawrence Karlton of Federal District Court here, concluded that the contribution limits were too low to pass constitutional muster.
abstract: Judge Lawrence Karlsen strikes down major parts of campaign contribution limits that became law when ballot initiative was approved by California voters in November 1996; rules contribution limits were unconstitutional (S)

headline.main: Judge Voids Part of Campaign Finance Law
